subject: Sales
title: Barter: The Original Transaction
description: One-minute skill: Barter: The Original Transaction.

hook.text: I have wheat but need a goat. You have a goat but want cloth. Barter needed a perfect coincidence.

buildup.text: For millennia, direct trade was the only way to exchange value between people.

discovery.text: The 'double coincidence of wants' was barter's fatal flaw: both sides had to want what the other had.

twist.text: This inefficiency drove the invention of money â€” the single greatest sales tool in human history.

climax.text: Barter taught the first rule of selling: discover what the other person values, then offer it.

punchline.text: Trade started with one question: what do you need?

quiz.question: What was barter's biggest limitation?
options: Both parties had to want what the other had
